txt.en: 'Backed out like the coward you are.'
Talk to Shúkurz
'Is that why you disappeared? We thought you were maggot-food!'
Fight Shúkurz
'Don't disappoint me, [placeholder]!'
'Well... don't keep the boss waiting.'
'Gather 'round, boys! Shúkurz's about to put on a show.'
Talk to Shúkurz
'A reward!'
'All right, all right, you've proven your point. What d'you even want?'
Follow Shúkurz
'Tell Gorgar I've found the [placeholder] who botched his weapons supply and set traitors free.'
Follow Shúkurz
'Just going to march up to Gorgar and make your demands?'
<rgb=#FF0000>Do not stray too far from Brukshar</rgb>
'...Maybe you've got more guts than I thought.'
'-- Oi, show's over! Get back to work!'
Shúkurz has brought you deep into Vatug-ronk, with the hope of learning Dhúrstrok's location.
'You want to know the way to Dhúrstrok? Well, here it is.'
'But mark my words: if anything seems funny or off about any of this...'
DNT
DNT
'Y-Yeah... been trying to catch this [placeholder].'
'You'll end up worse off than your buddies did.'
'And now that they've been freed, you'd better hope they don't come back to find you.'

You tell Shúkurz of the shadows you saw.

'But -- but if anyone had been in that tunnel, we would've seen them.

'...now I'LL be jumping at shadows! Okay, just keep your head down -- we'll be in and out fast.'
'Hear that, [placeholder]? Don't keep him waiting!'
You should continue following Shúkurz.
Shúkurz adopts a shaky fighting stance. His eyes dart towards your weapons, but he gives a subtle nod.
'I captured them alone. I'll prove it!'
You have strayed too far from Brukshar
Follow Shúkurz
'First thing's first, don't start a fight.'
'Haven't got a death wish, have you? Because I don't!'
'Even YOU can't fight off a cave full of Orcs. They'd kill me too!'
'It's time you folks let me go -- I've had enough of Gundabad.'
Talk to Shúkurz
'And then you'd have to kiss any chance you had of finding Dhúrstrok good-bye.'
'I don't plan on dying in Gundabad! No matter what, I'm getting out of here.'
Shadows shift in the periphery of your vision, but there is nothing there.
Talk to Shúkurz
Light footsteps follow you, echoing down the tunnel, but nobody is there.
'Get moving, [placeholder]. You'll make a pretty gift for Gorgar.'
'Phew!'
'The one who rescued those dwarves at the forge too.'
'Don't take the fight too far from me, you hear? Or I might start to think that you're actually a coward!'
Brukshar has called off the fight.\n\nYou should continue following Shúkurz.
The Orcs are eager for a fight.\n\nYou should try to communicate with Shúkurz... somehow.
DNT
You should follow Shúkurz deeper into the tunnel.
Shúkurz might have seen what you saw. It wouldn't hurt to ask him.
Shúkurz waits for you a little ways into the tunnel.

'Well, that went better than I expected! I was sure we were dead meat, but you put up a believable fight. And look -- we got a map to Dhúrstrok! Wow, it's all the way up in the catwalks. Bet the old lifts could take us there.'

You tell Shúkurz about the footsteps you heard on your way here. He quickly inspects your surroundings.

'Can't say I saw or heard anything strange. And you didn't see anyone, right? I think we should be okay.'
Shúkurz is trying to feign a believable fight.\n\nYou should play along, but stay close to Brukshar while fighting.
'Just follow my lead.'
You and Shúkurz have managed to obtain Dhúrstrok's location, all while escaping with your lives. But you've been noticing strange things....\n\nYou should talk to Shúkurz.
'Hah! Would you look at that? I thought you were lying!'
'Shúkurz?!'
Instance: Meeting the Quartermaster
'You captured the [placeholder] alone?'
'Oi! That's the bugger who set those traitors free!'
'I don't believe it. You didn't even have the guts to stand against Gorgar with your buddies!'
